result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry Lee Langner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The DOC shall deduct restitution and other court ordered financial obligations from the Defendant's prison income at a rate of 25% of the Defendant's work funds and the balance shall be a condition of supervision.   AMENDED 4/27/17 - Parties stipulate to the amount of restitution as reflected in Amended Dodge County Restitution Summary dated 1/26/17.
Shall submit a DNA sample; Shall submit to random urinalysis; shall comply with the Sex Offender Registry
Shall undergo a sex offender assessment and follow through with any recommendations;  Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent
Shall have no contact with anyone under the age of 18  without prior agent approval.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Document: Proposed Order - Restitution Order_1 - Langner, Terry Lee.docx Filed by: State of Wisconsin Reason: The provision that provides for money to be taken only from work accounts does not appear to be consistent with 973.20(11)(c) and the DOJ's interpretation of that statute.

records.addlTxt:
9:01. Defendant, Terry Lee Langner, in court, in custody with Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court and parties review and correct PSI information.  Attorney Tienstra heard regarding sentence.  Attorney Mayer heard.  Statement by Deft.  Court heard and ORDERS:

15 yrs in the WSPS
5 yrs IC
10 yrs ES
not eligible for CIP/SAP
adopting recommendations of presentence write for supervision
restitution is $2373.51 payable out of 25% of his work funds and the rest will be a condition of supervision
DNA sample
no voting
no firearms
384 days of presentence credit

11:08. Defendant, Terry Lee Langner, in court, in custody with Attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Attorney Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mayer heard.  Court reviews chrg + pnlts w/ Deft.  Deft enters NC plea.  Court reviews PQ/WOR w/ Deft.  Court finds suff fact basis, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty of charge.  Court advises Deft w/regards to firearm/voting/sex offender restrictions.  Court orders PSI to be done w/in 60 days  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Attorney William Andrew Mayer in court for Defendant Terry Lee Langner. Prosecuting Atty Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Tienstra heard, no agreement, will need to be left on for JT, any motions will be scheduled. Court finds victim rights compliance.

Defendant Terry Lee Langner in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court schedules out 3 weeks for another IPSTC and JT date; parties to contact JA today to schedule same.

9:48 am.    Defendant Terry Lee Langner in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 20 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Atty. Mayer is heard on bond modification motion.  Atty. Tienstra is heard.  Atty. Mayer responds.  Court is heard, Court will not modify bond, motion denied.
of intent to introduce DNA evidence (State's)

Defendant Terry Lee Langner in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def. will waive PH; Court reviews right to PH; Court finds Def. F&V waives right to PH; ARGN set; Atty. Mayer notes he will be filing and scheduling a bond motion; bond cont.; Def. remanded

Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with AAD, female, dob 2/3/2000 or her residence.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. No unsupervised contact with ANY minor females.

12:55 - Defendant Terry Lee Langner in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. DNA sample required. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $50,000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall submit a DNA sample at the Dodge County Jail.  Any defendant submitting a DNA sample may ask to have it expunged if applicable charges are dismissed  see Wis. Stat. Sec. 165.77(4).   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with AAD, juvenile female, dob 2/3/2000 or her residence.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. No unsupervised contact with ANY minor females.
